title: Ticket #4739: Shadow misinterprets output plugin message
description:
When file transfer plugins are used for output files (i.e. when OutputDestination is set in the job ad), the FileTransfer receiver (the shadow) misinterprets the data it receives from the sender. To see what type of transfer is happening, it looks up the Result attribute of the classad sent by the sender, when it should be looking up the SubCommand attribute.

This results in errors appearing in the shadow log like this: 

FILETRANSFER: unrecognized subcommand 0! skipping!

Fortunately, this doesn't appear to cause the transfer to fail.
